{"step_by_step_thinking": "Amblyopia, also known as lazy eye, is a vision development disorder in which an eye fails to achieve normal visual acuity, even with prescription eyeglasses or contact lenses. It begins during infancy and early childhood. In most cases, only one eye is affected, but in some cases, amblyopia can occur in both eyes. So, it does affect the eye.", "answer_choice": "A"}
